text: ...it was all me. I was there at the Black Eyed Peas concert...I made the intros...I got them hooked up...I told Cliff he couldn’t play games with an Alpha Phi girl when he was seeing that other little slut. And then when he was going to propose? Finally? He practiced on me to get it right.
So you gonna fuck him tonight, Rita? Scandalous laughter.
(recovering with a joke) I already did. More laughter -- until “Rita” spots OUR CAMERA.
You gimme that thing. Right. Now.
A scrum of his friends, film freaks, all hoisting Handyca and Coronas.
(unaware of CAMERA) “Puppet show?” She did a puppet show after I left?
Hey! What’s the good word for Cliff and Cydney? The guys orient to CAMERA.
Page 2.
First the big studio sale, now the big wedding. M.V.P. year for our boy Clifford....
I fuckin’ hate you, Anderson!
When you’re all famous, don’t forget your posse from film class. Boys in the ‘Wood Hood.
You dance with who brung ya, Cliff, you dance with who brung ya....
(still not to CAMERA) It’s bullshit, right? Puppets just can’t pop out of a body like that. You guys’re just makin’ shit up ‘cuz I split the party early....
Bouquet toss. The girls leap and scramble.
Garter toss. The guys bob and weave.
The BAND PLAYS Gary Hoey’s “Money.” Background, we see th bride, CYDNEY, wearing pinned-on greenbacks. Foreground, CHEAP MAN has his buck all ready to go.

It’s called “a dollar dance.” CHEAP MAN’S WIFE In 1967, it was a “dollar dance.” Try a fifty. As they wrangle over denominations, Cydney changes dance partners in the background. A BEAR OF A MAN wraps her up.
The CROWD ROARS approval: Cydney just pushed cake into he husband’s face. Sputtering, CLIFF takes off his glasses a looks around. All we see are two eyes and a mouth.
Page 3. Facial!
Cliff! You look like a white bowling ball, dude!
Gift table. Unsupervised, the RING BOY and FLOWER GIRL te open wedding gifts. Christmas came early.
The PARENTS OF THE GROOM. Father is retired Navy. trying to determine the exit-strategy. He’s
Now I am still transporting Cliff and Cydney to the airport, correct? First thing in the morning?
That changed. We’re picking them up after the honeymoon.
Just put it on paper, that’s all I ask. If Cliff can write a 120-page story for them, maybe he can write a one-page movement-order for his father. Where is that boy, anyway?
The bar. Cliff is put in a headlock by an aggressively dr TOMMY. It’s an old sibling ritual that Cliff keeps hoping will die a natural death. It hasn’t.
My little brother gettin’ married before me, huh?
Yeah, I wonder why. Barkeep!
C’mon, let up.
‘Nother brewsky here, huh?
Tommy, your armpit smells like ass, okay? Will you let the fuck up? Christ, 28 years old and he’s still doin’ it to me....
Page 4.
Came all the way from Michigan to do this one more time....
Tommy savagely knuckle-rubs the top of Cliff’s head.
Pool deck. CYDNEY’S SISTER tries to hide her cigarette wh being interviewed on CAMERA. She’s with a CLUELESS HUSBAN who pages through a guide book of Hawaii.

CYDNEY’S SISTER ...well, far be it from my little sister to do the typical honeymoon -a high-rise in Waikik snorkel-pond? Don’t think so. Some friends of ours did The Kalalau Trail last year and came back with the most amazing pictures, so -CLUELESS HUSBAND So they’re going to Maui, right? 2
Sister rolls her eyes. CAM PUSHES IN on a fold-out map of the Hawaiian islands as Husband gets corrected.

CYDNEY’S SISTER “Kauai.” The last island, number five, one-two-three-four-five, right there. And hon, if you don’t know what you’re sayin’, please don’t say it on camera, ‘kay? (back to CAMERA) I think they just wanted to start off their lives together with some kind of...adventure....

EXT. “W” HOTEL - WESTWOOD - NIGHT 2 VIDEO: Cliff and Cydney dash for the limo. He’s a winning combination of looks and smarts. She’s Alpha Phi, all ros and honey. Details beyond that are lost in a blizzard of rice, confetti, camera flashes. With his own Handycam, Cl tapes the WELL-WISHERS all around them. 3

VIDEO: We’re SHOOTING Cliff from the POV of his own lap. He laps a shaved ice as he drives some kind of convertibl palm trees gliding through FRAME, everything set against achingly blue sky. 3  Page 5.
I have a question for you, Mr. Cliff Anderson of Venice Beach, California....
Yes, Mrs. Cydney Anderson, formally Miss Cydney Carswell of Pacific Palisades, California....
How’d you get the little scar? Her finger enters FRAME, touching under his chin. CYDNEY (O.S./CONT’D) Can’t believe I just found it.
Long story. Involves Homeland Security and me being unexpectedly pressed into service as a deputy air marshal. I don’t talk about it much. Try again.
Less grandiose.
Brother hit me with his skateboard when I was nine years old. Claims it was an accident.
Which brother’s this?
That’d be Tommy. Michigan. The one from
Thought he said “Maryland” at the wedding.
Excuse me, whose brother is this?
Well, I saw like 16 brothers there. Okay, “Tommy from Michigan.” A new wife should know these things....
Page 6.
FLY CAM SHOT: Our first FILM VIEW reveals Cydney with her head in Cliff’s lap, Handycam rolling, her feet out the passenger window of a yellow Jeep. They drive through the endless lushness of Kauai.
“Mrs. Cydney Anderson...Mrs. Cydney Carswell Anderson....” It’s like writing checks in January -- I know I’m going to blow it.
Keep practicing.
Practice on this....
She steals his shaved ice, gives it a suggestively long l
Didn’t that guidebook say there were no snakes in Hawaii? 4
4 Outside, we see a WHAPPING helo on the pad, head-dipped tourists boarding. Inside, we FIND Cliff at the counter, paying cash for an upcoming tour.
Now what about the extra video? Camera’s right there in front of you, getting all your reactions. We cut it into scenery from the tour.
(patting Handycam) Think I’ll take my own, thanks.
Have it ready before you leave.
Just the one-hour “Fly Over To Die Over,” please. And might’nt you’ve come up with a better name?
An unwatched TV drones nearby, volume low.
...from all over the world, some to get married, some on their honeymoon, (MORE)
Page 7.

others to simply enjoy the trade winds and liquid sunshine. But for at least two young people, it seems paradise became a very dangerous place. Reporting from Honolulu is our own Katie Nakamura.... That HELO REVS UP outside. Cliff joins Cydney at the wind to watch the take-off -- but CAMERA STAYS BEHIND on that where the scene changes to a field reporter at a major cr scene. The HELO drowns out her words, but the ticker at t bottom of the screen reads... “Grisly Discovery At Honolulu Harbor.” 5
5 OUR AIRBORNE POV sweeps up and over a mountain ridge to reveal the great Wai’ale’ale Crater. Our stomachs drop ou beneath us. What a rush. 6
6 We find Cliff and Cydney inside the sight-seeing chopper Cliff hangs out the starboard side to get it all on tape. Cydney hangs onto him, not trusting the harnesses.
Get back in here!
Never knew there were so many shades of green! Here, get a picture of me! Everywhere, waterfalls drop 3,000 feet. Earth’s rivers end right here. 7 It’s like all the

The sight-seeing chopper overflys the Waimea Canyon, the “Grand Canyon of the Pacific,” all wild and raw... Exotic Manawaiopuna Falls, familiar from “Jurassic Park”. A pod of whales breaching coastal waters... And the great Napali Coast. Steep green mountains, carved by a million years of erosion, end abruptly at the Pacifi Ocean. A hiking trail is seen twisting and turning with t coastline. 7  Page 8. 8
8 From that trail below, TINY TREKKERS wave to us.
(to pilot) I’m gonna do that! Kalalau! trail right down there! That

Did it myself, back-in-the-day! Show you what it’s all for.... They THUNDER on toward... Kalalau Beach, a golden crescent of sand. Mountains cordo it off from inland areas -- and the rest of civilization.
Most gorgeous dead-end God ever made!
Forget the hike! Just drop us off right now!
Only two ways in and out, Cydney -on foot or by kayak. Bu makes it special! The pilot banks away. Cydney and Cliff crane necks to kee the beach in view as long as possible. 9
9 FLY CAM SHOT: In a valley floor quilted with taro fields, Cliff and Cydney drive over a one-lane bridge and head fo the sleepy town of Hanalei. 10
10 The yellow Jeep parks. One tire stops right on a discarde newspaper, the “Oahu Daily News.” 11

Now how many days you allow? A native SUPPLY GUY huddles with Cliff over a trail map. Nearby, his greying EARTH MOMMA wife rings purchases -deh mess kits, magnesium fire-starter, white gas stove. 11  Page 9.
One day in, one on the beach, another day out?
Common mistake.
You think I need more?
I don’t know if you’ll need more, but you’ll sure want more. But so long as you got your permits and they’re generally up-to-date....
Yeah, yeah, right here.... He keeps them inside a color brochure.

(checking permits) Because the rangers do get out and work the trail, especially after the three-mile marker. So you want to keep these close, Cliff. Frowning, Cliff pulls a can off a shelf. It’s some kind o cut-rate Spam. If such a thing is possible.
People will actually eat this? “Potted Meat Product?”
Honey, I won’t even read the ingredients. Comes to $427.57. Cydney appears with a few more things -- hats, sunblock, bandana -- adds them to the check-out pile.
And these. (snuggling up to Cliff) Miss me?
(scowling at map) Three days sounds plenty to me.... Through an unwashed window, we see a primer-grey El Camin park outside.
Page 10.
Nine whole minutes -- that’s the longest we’ve been away from each other since we got married. You musta missed me something awful, huh?
(to Supply Guy) 11.5 miles, right? Each way?
(in Cliff’s ear) C’mon, just say you did. I’ll give you a b.j. in the car...another one....

But see, you’re gonna cross five valleys, and each time you do, you’re gonna gain or lose 1,000 feet of elevation. That’s the killer. CLOSE on a mechanical parrot mounted above the entrance d the Hawaiian equivalent of a dingle-bell. It SQUAWKS as someone enters.
(mock huffy) Well, I missed you.
(teasing her) What, did you go somewhere?
Make that $475.35.
Cliff produces a wad of cash.
Know it looks like I robbed a bank, but....

Our wedding haul. Now reveal CHRONIC, the owner of the El Camino. He’s a blonde-dreaded Rasta-punk with a beaded “CHRONIC” choker around his neck. (NOTE: Chronic and Earth Momma slip into local pidgin-spe It happens background.)
Howzit, baby boy.... (kissing him) (MORE)
Page 11.
Glad see back. Nowhere near Honolulu, were you?
(shaking head) Other side. Waves was junk for three days, mo bettah here. Why, what’s the stink in ‘Lulu?
(remembering customers) Maybe nuff for now. Wanna help these two out to their car?

Shoots, yeah. Just dump my gear, be ri’ widdem. Chronic flashes Cliff and Cydney a grin before heading fo the rear of the store. He seems like a harmless doper. Though he did get a look at Cliff’s wad of cash.
(to Earth Momma) I think we got it. Thanks. 12
12 Finished loading, Cliff and Cydney hop back into the Jeep As they CRANK OVER, the Supply Guy and his wife step outs to see them off.
And get an early start! Aloha!

A friendly round of waves. But as Cliff backs up... One tire uncovers that Oahu newspaper -- the one they nev saw. A photo shows two bodies covered in bloody sheets. The headline reveals “Young Couple Butchered in Honolulu. 13
14 13 First light bathes the island gold.
FLY CAM SHOT: We’re bombing along Highway 560 in our yell Jeep, en route to the trailhead. 93.5 (“KONG”) plays some bouncy reggae, “I Need Your Love.” 14
Page 12.

(singing along) Won’t you open up your heart... And let me in... For you and I will never part... That you should know, so... I need your love for more than just an hour... I need your love more than just a day... So hold me close, my love will never falter... I need your love each and every day... Na-na-na-na-na-na.... Cliff joins in on the NA-NA-NA chorus.
I love our new lives. The Jeep wheels onward, soon rounding a bend and passing. Two hitchers, backs turned, thumbs out. Cliff pulls over.
What’re you doin’?
It’s Hawaii. It’s a two-word defense unto itself. Cydney scowls at her side mirror. There we see the two hitchers hustling close Male and female, late 20s.
So in Hawaii, Cliff and Cydney do things they normally wouldn’t? Like pick up hitch-hikers?

Nothing bad ever happens here, right? HIS REARVIEW MIRROR POV: Of the hitchers. The closer get, the dodgier they get: The girl looks like Oxnard skank, wearing an almost-nuthin’ bandana top. The guy dark and ripped, the kind of rip you get from steroids prison. Or steroids in prison.
That’s a hard look they got.... they surfer is or  Page 13. KALE (him) and CLEO (her) sling their rucksacks aboard.
How far you goin’?
Lumahai beach? That area?
(buying time) Lumahai...Lumahai...not sure we know that....
‘Bout 10 miles ahead, right on this road. You know, right by where the big trail starts. You know that trail?

Oh, yeah, sure. That big trail.... Cliff spots a tattoo on Kale’s chest. It’s right where an E.R. doctor might want to put his defib paddle. And it sa “DO NOT REVIVE.” CLIFF (CONT’D) ...but we aren’t goin’ that far. Cydney looks relieved. But Kale looks unhappy about getti out of a ride he’s already in. Especially when that ride full of trail gear.
So how far do you go?

Just, y’know. Up the road here. (off Kale’s stare) So if you just hang here another five minutes, maybe someone else comes along who can take you all the -CLEO We was waitin’ for, like, an hour ‘fore you stopped. Maybe more. Shit, thought this was Hawaii. Kale jumps out, grabs his rucksack. C’mon.
With a desperate edge, Cleo produces photos and starts showing them to Cydney.  Page 14.
Some of these pitchers totally suck -just one of those ca afterwards. But this one, this one’s good....
These people wanna see less of us, Cleo. Not more.
That’s Kale gettin’ a new tatt.... Uh-huh....
Oh, here, here it is. That’s us doin’ the deed on Oahu -- just woke up one morning and decided to get married. Pretty, isn’t it?
(coming around) Oh, yeah. It is pretty with that whole arbor of.... (a double-take) Is this a grocery store?

“Paula’s Market.” They do it up real nice for you -- put that big hoop thing over your head with all kinds of lettuces and pineapple parts and stuff. Produce manager took that pitcher. I know it sounds kinda tacky? But it was pretty friggin’ pretty after they added all the little radishes in there.... Cydney shows the photo to Cliff.
Kale and Cleo getting married on Oahu.
(nodding “nice”) Suitable for framing. He taps his wedding ring on the steering wheel, deliberat a beat before...  Page 15.
Tell you what. We’ll just drive you there.
Only 10 miles, right? there by now. Coulda been
Maybe next time. Aw, Kale.
Don’t be that way.
Get out, baby.

C’mon, guys. Let’s not turn this into a bigger deal than it really -KALE Cleo. Get the fuck out of this man’s ride. Cleo knows that tone of voice -- and knows to respect it. Kale rounds the car for a private word with Cliff.
My mother, she was like this... metaphysical gypsy Christian psychic chick. Know the type, right? Oh, sure.

I used to think she was messed up in the head, but then sometimes... something occurs...that makes me think I acquired some of her gypsy powers. Like right now. Right now I do believe I can divine what you’re thinking.
An’ what’s that?
“I hope I never run into this dire motherfucker again.” It’s a pretty good guess. Kale raps on the Jeep like a ca salesman seeing you off the lot.
Page 16.
Take care, Hot Wheels. Cliff takes the cue and hits the gas. 15
So. Could we maybe have handled that better? Forget it. mirror.
Already in my rearview Of Kale and Cleo. Growing small.

16 Two kinds of people here: Those who haven’t done the trai unpack cars energetically. Those who just finished the tr -- muddy to the knees -- load cars like the living dead. VIDEO POV: Smiles back in place, Cliff and Cydney pose ne a sign heralding the “Kalalau Trail.” Per norm, Cydney is draped all over Cliff. When the VIDEO IMAGE CLICKS OFF... We CUT BACK to our FILM VIEW. Handycam to Cliff. Look good? A CAMERA SAMARITAN returns the
I was just pointing and shooting. Too many buttons on these new things.
Yeah -- that’s what you get for buyin’ top-of-the-line. Might have to actually break down and read the manual someday.
Let’s get it star-ted...let’s get it star-ted in here.... Cliff and Cydney shrug into their packs and hit the trail They pass another sign.

Page 17. 17 EXT. ABOVE KE’E BEACH - THE TRAIL - DAY 17 A half-hour later. Now baptized in sweat and mud, Cliff a Cydney reach an open spot on the trail and look back on.. The northern tip of the island. Sunlight rakes across Ke’ beach and its postcard-perfect reef lagoon. Beyond that l a sea of undulating glass.

The perfect getaway. 18 EXT. CRAWLER’S LEDGE - THE TRAIL - DAY The terra-cotta trail narrows. To the right is one of tho “steep drop-offs.” Making things worse, a weepy waterfall drains across the trail ahead, and some of the rocks seem slippery with moss. (VFX SHOTS.)
Well, everyone else did it.
Did they really? He leans right, checking for bodies that might be litteri the CRASHING SURF far below.

Show it no fear. Coming up from behind is NICK, 32. He wears nylon jeans, sport sandals, mil-spec Boonie hat, an engaging grin -- a wrapped up in an air of invincibility. Make that “a flair of invincibility.
(re trail) Is some of it washed out, or....
Watch me. Keep your eyes down, your speed up...avoid the green rocks... and just...be...fearless. Just like that, he’s across the bad patch.
(to Cliff) Made it look easy.
He’s not wearing an A-16 store on his back.

Page 18. In fact, all Nick carries is a butane tank and walking st Now Cliff girds and goes. He’s not as slick as Nick, but makes it to the other side without calamity. Nick pulls h past and now motions for... Cydney. Starting across. Nick holds out his stick, offering it should she need it. Below Cydney, WAVES BOOM ONTO ROCKS.

Doin’ good, Cydney, doin’ real good.... Suddenly a TOURIST HELO ROCKETS overhead. Cydney startles. Her foot hits a green rock. Pushes off. Slips. Cydney totters on the edge, her hand grabbing blindly for Nick’s stick. Missing...missing... And snagging it. Nick pulls hard and straight. Suddenly Cydney is on the other side, the safe side, reeled into Nick’s arms. Shit.
Did I almost die right there?
Not on my watch.
C’mere, c’mere....
Thought I was doin’ pretty well until that damn.... Cliff takes possession of the shaken Cydney. for Nick, he’s already heading out. Hey!
What’s your name? When they look  Page 19. 19
19 Hiking as a threesome now:
Now have we crossed paths before? Some theater of the world? ‘Cuz when I first saw you guys, I was feelin’ a little deja-vuey.
Nowhere I remember, Nick.
But that face.... actor, Cliff? You some kinda
No, no, no.
Haven’t seen you on TV.
No such luck.
Actually, Cliff’s a screenplay writer, very sought-after. Several of the big studios want him for their movie projects now.
Knew I smelled fame and fortune on you. Screenplay writer, huh?
(mock humble) We say “screenwriter.”
Any movies I might know?
Well, my first script is actually in pre-production right now. So ask me again this time next year, and....
Who’s in it?
Still trying to figure that out. Still casting up.
Page 20.
Well, Nick Cage is always money in my book. I like how he gets all mad

head_text.subj: RIGHT AT THE END OF THE SENTENCE

text: So you got a good Act Two twist?
(suddenly on guard) You, uh, in the business, Nick?
Me? Nah. Just took some course -one of those writing boot Had so many ass-puckering experiences in life, I figure, hell, I’ll just throw ‘em down on paper, make myself a million bucks.
Not so easy, is it?
I liked it all ‘cept the paperwork -y’know, actually maki got the basics down -- three acts, hero with a journey, red snappers. All that stuff.
“Red snappers?”
You know, you bring in a character just to mess with the audience. You try to throw ‘em off-track by -“Herring.”
“Red herring.”
Pretty sure it’s “snapper.” ‘Scuse me while I shake the bush here.... Nick steps off-trail, unzips. looks out over the ocean. Cliff does likewise.
So you’re like halfway to famous, huh, Cliff?
There’s a whole big crew gettin’ ready up in Vancouver. Building sets. Cydney  Page 21.
(frowning) They’re there and you’re here?
Well, it’s a long story, but...they brought on another guy to do a quick rewrite.
On your story?
Just a two-week punch-up. Yeah?
And how long ago was this?
Uh...nine weeks.
(shaking head) That ain’t right. It’s your baby, your vision, Cliff. Shouldn’t let them get away with that.

He’s got these agents, but they don’t want to fight for him. I finally told Cliff he just should get new -CLIFF Hey, not that “me” isn’t my favorite subject? But maybe we can just talk about something else for awhile. Jesus.
(zipping up) I’ll just say one more thing, Cliff. One last pearl of wisdom.
Get a new agent?
Get a new story. Nick’s eyes are dancing: He may have just the one in mind.
Page 22. 20

20 Stalled on the trail are THREE CORN-FED KANSAS CITY GIRLS late teens whose adjective-de-jour is “major.” They’re al jabbing cell phones with frustrating results. When they s Cliff, Cydney, and Nick approaching...
You hear about Oahu? What happened there? Why?
What did happen?

Well, my dad just called from K.C.K.? Couldn’t hear everything, reception’s like major shit out here, but... he was sayin’ something about some murders.... Suddenly everyone has a cell phone out, thumbing buttons wandering around for reception like dowsers searching for water. Flat-line.
In and out. Mostly out. (to girls) Was this in Honolulu?
“Dad” wants us to leave. I think he’s in major over-reaction mode, okay?
Some newlyweds got killed. Is that right, Lori? That what he said?
God, we were just there. yesterday. Day before
No way do I chicken-shit outta here. We planned this for five-and-a-half months. Does he not even know it’s a different island?
What else he say, your dad? know who did it? Do they
Page 23.
Looking for two people -- man and a woman. ‘Sall I got.
(to Cliff) Like that movie, huh? Killers?” “Natural Born Girls #1 and #2 actually gasp.
Oh, that movie so freaked me out. Majorly.
When his head is doing that thing? Girl #3, the one who wants to stay, squints raw ire at Ni “Thanks, asshole.”
(to Cydney) Whaddya think?
That’s Oahu, not here.
Speak now or forever hold your peace....
This is our honeymoon. (to K.C. girls) C’mon, guys, you can hike with us. We’re going all the way to Kalalau Beach. All the way to the end. Hey.
(a beat) So you’re like...newlyweds.
Well, that’s cool...but, uh, I think we’re just gonna get the hell out of Hawaii. Thanks anyway.
Second the motion!
Page 24.

(to Cydney and Cliff, creeped out for them) Hokay. Have a swell honeymoon, guys.... The K.C. girls grab packs and start back for the trail-he Girl #3 follows reluctantly, HARANGUING the other two as major cowards. But soon they’re all running. 21
21 FLY CAM SHOT: We’re short-cutting over switchbacks, our AIRBORNE CAMERA soon finding Cliff, Cydney, and Nick back the move. 22
Well, my exit here. hard yards ahead. Be safe -- some Leaving the main trail, Nick starts up a connecting path. Cydney notes a rock painted with a cryptic “S.F.”
You’re camping at “Secret Falls?” (off Nick’s look) Well, they talk about it in the guide book.
Just for the day. Had to run back to the truck for a little butane.
How close is it?
Like everything else in Hawaii -“As close as faraway gets
(to Cliff, hopeful) Sounds romantic.... Cliff considers the new trail. It’s steep, slippery, lace with tree roots. Not so romantic.
Wanna make that beach by sunset.
Page 25.
(to Nick) It’s only, what, a mile? The falls?
Maybe we should let the man have his privacy.

Don’t matter to me. to go around. Plenty of Eden About to decline, Cliff spots... Two trekkers on a switchback far behind them. One is male the other female. And they look uncomfortably like.... What?
She tracks his gaze, but now the two trekkers have slippe from sight. Was it even them?
One mile, huh? 23
En route to Secret Falls, Nick and Cydney are in the lead chatting it up like old friends.

...and all of Cliff’s family came into town -- he’s Catholic, or at least he began that way, so that was kind of a happy invasion. And I’ve got a big family, too, all really close...and then my other sisters had to be invited, my sorority sisters.... Kept going up and up, but I’d say we had 300 people at the reception... maybe more. But I’ll tell you, it was just the most magical weekend.... Nick helps her over the rough patches, once pushing on he ass when she threatens to fall back onto him. They laugh off as they PASS CAMERA. Next comes... The unlaughing Cliff. He’s sweating like pig at a luau, struggling with the grade and the weight on his back. Stopping for water, he turns to check... 23  Page 26. The trail behind us. We listen carefully for a few moment but hear only BIRD CALLS. No human sounds. Satisfied he’s alone, Cliff turns back and bumps into Nic
Gotta maintain your grouping. This way. 24

24 OUR BUSHWHACKING POV: The bamboo soon parts to reveal a grotto of matchless beauty. A single cataract of water dr 50 feet to feed a limpid pool reserved for... A water nymph. Stroking languidly across the pool. Cydney sheds her pack. watching... The nymph. Cliff squats and leans back on his, Switching to backstroke, she rolls over.
I do believe...she’s clotheless.
I do believe...he is too. Nick is shedding externals as he moves to the pool. He di in like a human blade, barely rippling the surface, then resurfaces to greet the water nymph mouth-first.
Did he mention Gina before?

head_text.subj: THE CRAZY-ASS LOVE OF MY CRAZY-ASS

text: Mentioning it right now. Okay.
So they’re like ”a couple.” Cydney slides him a look. stop it.” “I know what you’re thinking and
YA’LL COMIN’ IN OR WHAT?  Page 27.
(to Cliff) Are we all goin’ in or what?
(taking out cell phone) Gimme a minute...see if I can get some reception here....
Well, while you’re doin’ that.... Feeling frisky, she reaches back and plucks the strings o her halter top. It draws a look from Cliff.

“It’s Hawaii.” The halter hits the ground. With one arm draped demurely across her chest, Cydney moves to pool’s edge and swipes toe. She deliberates over her Calvin Klein’s but eases in with them still on.
Burr-r-r-r-r....
(to Gina) Guess the carpet don’t match the drapes....

(splashing him) Oh, you shush up. INTERCUT Cliff, firing up his cell phone. It’s tricked ou Internet capable. The reception’s still on life-support - Cliff looks up-waterfall. terrace? Can he get up there? Cydney and Gina meet up in the pool.
Hope we’re not intruding on your own private paradise here.
Forget it. Nicko’s always bringin’ home strays.
“Mrs. Cydney Anderson.” newlyweds. We’re To that  Page 28.
“Miss Gina Scruggs.” We’re not. She shoots a not-so-subtle look in Nick’s direction. shoots a little palm-squirt back at her. He
(back to Cydney) ‘Cuz, you see, it’s illegal to marry children.
Even in Georgia? She goes after him. 25 He dives away in mock horror.
25 FLY CAM: Moving better without his pack, Cliff reaches th top of the waterfall and the stream that feeds it.

He checks his phone. Same crappy signal. He waves the pho overhead like a witch doctor shaking a talisman, checks again. Ah, that’s better. Cliff goes on-line. Googles “Honolulu murders.” Gets some hits, a lot of hits. Picks the most promising one. 26
26 Treading water:

He reaches out and takes her hand. “CLIFF” It’s you who helps create this -this fever-dream of immor You’re the privileged witness who’s going to help me lead a hundred different lives. It’s you. I love the idea Two “loves” in the same breath: It doesn’t even add up to one, really, not in the real world. But it’s more than “Cydney” typically gets. “CYDNEY” And I love hearing it. It’s sick, it’s sad, but I do. Does that make me crazy, Rocky?
“CLIFF” It makes you exciting. She accepts the pipe. Accepts the blood-letting to come. “CYDNEY” (as Gina) “Well, whoopty-tah.” Now “Cliff” lines up Nick with his pistol-fingers.

The PHONE EXPLODES in Gina’s hand. A chunk of her palm fl away with it. HOWLING pain, Gina keeps kicking until suddenly... She’s free. "Cliff" makes one more blind-grab. And misses. Sorry about all this. It’s been a helluva vacation, believe me. And here we all thought it was going to be the trip of a life -KAYAKER #1 Just tell us what’s going on.

Her name is Gina. She’s a friend of my wife’s, and she has a little issue with, uh, well, crystal meth, okay? She’s normally pretty functional, but as you can see, this ain’t normal.
Iced out of her mind right now. Here, lookit this. Proving his point, he picks up a foil wonton. where Gina fell off the rope ladder. It “fell”

Look, we’re just out here ‘cuz someone took off with two of our boats. Last thing we want is to step in someone else’s mess. Right?
Yeah, right. Except....  Page 92.
‘Cept what?
